SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Protect Personal Identifiable Information in Guest Buyer Carts and Orders

Simplify your organization's sharing settings and continue providing a trusted experience for both authenticated and unauthenticated buyers. When you allow a guest buyer to create a cart or place an order, ensure that the guest buyer's personal identifiable information (PII) remains secure. This release removes a dependency on sharing rules that were previously required for guest user access to carts, orders, and address data.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce required sharing rules for the following objects for storefronts that allowed guest users to manage carts and check out:

CC Cart
CC Contact Address
CC Order

These sharing rules ensured that your storefront complied with required security alerts and still supported guest buyer carts and orders in the following ways:

Prevented a guest buyer from owning any records, and reassigned ownership to an Experience Cloud site user that was the default owner for all guest user records. For example, when a guest user created a cart, the Owner field on the CC Cart record was set to this default guest user record owner.
Granted access to a guest-created cart, order, or contact address to only that default owner.

This release removes the dependency on the specific sharing rules, and ensures that guest user carts and checkout continue to function correctly without the rules.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, remove the existing sharing rules for the CC Cart, CC Contact Address, and CC Order custom objects. Complete the steps in Remove Sharing Rules for Carts, Orders, and Addresses.

TIP If you're upgrading from B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) and you already completed these steps for patch 3.147.8 or later, no extra steps are required.
SEE ALSO
Resolve Guest User Security Alerts to Keep Your Storefronts Secure by Default

title: Protecting PII in B2B Commerce for Visualforce
